title: Mount_Omurga
article:
Mount Omurga

Mount Omurga is a mountain peak located in the Crimean Mountains, Ukraine. It is one of the highest peaks in the range and offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. This article provides an overview of Mount Omurga, including its geography, geology, climate, history, and recreational activities.

# Geography

Mount Omurga is situated in the Crimean Mountains, a mountain range that runs along the southern coast of Ukraine. The mountain range is approximately 160 kilometers (99 miles) long and 50 kilometers (31 miles) wide. Mount Omurga is one of the highest peaks in the range, with an elevation of 1,546 meters (5,072 feet) above sea level.

## Location

Mount Omurga is located in the southwestern part of the Crimean Mountains, near the city of Yalta. The mountain is situated in the Yalta Mountains Nature Reserve, a protected area that covers over 14,000 hectares (34,600 acres) of land. The reserve is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including many rare and endangered species.

## Physical Characteristics

Mount Omurga is a rugged and rocky mountain peak, with steep slopes and a distinctive summit. The mountain is composed of limestone and sandstone rocks, which have been eroded over time to form a unique landscape of ridges and valleys. The summit of the mountain is marked by a distinctive rocky outcrop, which offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape.

# Geology

Mount Omurga is a geological formation that dates back to the Jurassic period, over 150 million years ago. The mountain is composed of limestone and sandstone rocks, which were formed from the remains of ancient sea creatures and sediments.

## Rock Formations

The rocks that make up Mount Omurga are part of the Crimean Mountains geological formation, which is characterized by a series of limestone and sandstone layers. These layers were formed over millions of years, as sediment was deposited on the sea floor and compressed into rock. The rocks that make up Mount Omurga are highly eroded, with many visible cracks and fissures.

## Mineral Deposits

Mount Omurga is known for its mineral deposits, including limestone, sandstone, and marble. These deposits have been mined for centuries, and have played an important role in the local economy.

# Climate

Mount Omurga has a Mediterranean climate, with warm summers and mild winters. The mountain is exposed to the full force of the Mediterranean Sea, which has a moderating effect on the climate.

## Weather Patterns

The weather on Mount Omurga is characterized by warm, sunny summers and mild, wet winters. The mountain is susceptible to storms, which can bring heavy rain and strong winds. The summit of the mountain is often shrouded in cloud, which can make navigation difficult.

## Temperature and Precipitation

The average temperature on Mount Omurga ranges from 5°C (41°F) in winter to 25°C (77°F) in summer. The mountain receives an average of 500 millimeters (20 inches) of precipitation per year, with most of the rain falling during the winter months.

# History

Mount Omurga has a rich and varied history, dating back to the ancient Greeks and Romans. The mountain has been home to many different cultures and civilizations, each leaving their mark on the landscape.

## Ancient History

The ancient Greeks and Romans were the first to inhabit the area around Mount Omurga. They established a series of settlements and trading posts, which thrived due to the mountain's strategic location.

## Medieval History

During the Middle Ages, Mount Omurga was home to a series of medieval castles and fortifications. These were built by the Genoese and the Venetians, who used the mountain as a base for their trading and military operations.

## Modern History

In the 19th century, Mount Omurga became a popular destination for tourists and hikers. The mountain was also home to a series of sanatoriums and health resorts, which catered to the needs of the wealthy and the aristocratic.

# Recreational Activities

Mount Omurga is a popular destination for recreational activities, including hiking, rock climbing, and skiing.

## Hiking

The mountain offers a number of hiking trails, ranging from easy to challenging. The trails offer breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape, and are suitable for hikers of all ages and abilities.

## Rock Climbing

Mount Omurga is a popular destination for rock climbers, with a number of routes and climbs suitable for all levels of experience. The mountain's rugged and rocky terrain offers a unique challenge for climbers.

## Skiing

In the winter months, Mount Omurga is home to a number of ski resorts and slopes. The mountain offers a range of skiing and snowboarding opportunities, from beginner to advanced.

# Conservation Efforts

Mount Omurga is a protected area, and is home to a number of conservation efforts. The mountain is part of the Yalta Mountains Nature Reserve, which is dedicated to preserving the natural beauty and biodiversity of the area.

## National Park

The Yalta Mountains Nature Reserve is a national park, which is protected by law. The park is home to a number of rare and endangered species, including the Crimean marten and the Taurian frog.

## Conservation Organizations

A number of conservation organizations are working to protect the natural beauty and biodiversity of Mount Omurga. These organizations include the Ukrainian Ministry of Environment and Natural Resources, and the World Wildlife Fund.

# Conclusion

Mount Omurga is a unique and fascinating mountain peak, with a rich and varied history and geography. The mountain offers a number of recreational activities, including hiking, rock climbing, and skiing. Mount Omurga is also home to a number of conservation efforts, which are dedicated to preserving the natural beauty and biodiversity of the area.

Armorial of Albania

The Armorial of Albania is a collection of coats of arms used by various noble families, feudal lords, and institutions throughout Albanian history. The use of coats of arms in Albania dates back to the medieval period, and over the centuries, various powers and empires have influenced the development of Albanian heraldry.

# Medieval period

During the medieval period, Albania was a crossroads of various empires and powers, including the Byzantine Empire, the Kingdom of Serbia, and the Republic of Venice. This led to the introduction of various heraldic traditions and influences.

## Ambiguitatem

In the 13th century, the Byzantine Empire dominated much of the Balkan region, including Albania. The Byzantine Empire used a system of heraldry based on the use of emblems and symbols, rather than coats of arms in the modern sense. These emblems often featured mythological creatures, such as eagles and dragons, and were used to represent the emperor and his court.

## Regnum Albaniæ

In the 14th century, the Kingdom of Albania was established by Charles of Anjou, a French nobleman. The Kingdom of Albania used a coat of arms featuring a double-headed eagle, which was also used by the Byzantine Empire. This symbol was later adopted by the Albanian nobility and became a popular motif in Albanian heraldry.

## Feudal lords

During the medieval period, Albania was also home to various feudal lords, who used their own coats of arms to represent their families and territories. These coats of arms often featured symbols and emblems associated with the lord's family or territory, such as animals, plants, and geographic features.

# Albanian nobility

The Albanian nobility played a significant role in the development of Albanian heraldry. Many noble families used coats of arms to represent their families and territories, and these coats of arms were often passed down through generations.

## Austria–Hungary

In the 16th century, Albania was conquered by the Ottoman Empire, but some parts of the country remained under the control of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. The Austro-Hungarian Empire used a system of heraldry based on the use of coats of arms, and many Albanian noble families adopted this system.

## Italian States

Italy also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the north of the country. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with the Italian states.

### La Serenìssima

The Republic of Venice, also known as La Serenìssima, had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the coastal regions. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with the Republic of Venice, such as the lion of St. Mark.

#### Albania Vèneta

Albania Vèneta was a region in northern Albania that was under the control of the Republic of Venice. Many noble families in this region used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with the Republic of Venice.

#### Dalmatia

Dalmatia was a region in southern Croatia that was also under the control of the Republic of Venice. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with Dalmatia.

#### Istria

Istria was a region in northwestern Croatia that was also under the control of the Republic of Venice. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with Istria.

### Dicio Pontificia

The Papal States also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the south of the country. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with the Papal States.

### Genoa, Neapolis, Sicilia...

Other Italian states, such as Genoa, Naples, and Sicily, also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with these states.

## Moldavia & Romania

Moldavia and Romania also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the north of the country. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with Moldavia and Romania.

## Greece

Greece also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the south of the country. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with Greece.

## Ottoman Empire

In the 16th century, Albania was conquered by the Ottoman Empire, which had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with the Ottoman Empire.

### Grand viziers

The grand viziers of the Ottoman Empire used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with their office. Many Albanian noble families used these coats of arms as a symbol of their loyalty to the Ottoman Empire.

## Egypt

Egypt also had a significant influence on Albanian heraldry, particularly in the 19th century. Many Albanian noble families used coats of arms featuring symbols and emblems associated with Egypt.

# Modern period

In the modern period, Albania has developed its own system of heraldry, which is based on the use of coats of arms and other symbols. Many Albanian institutions and organizations use coats of arms to represent themselves, and these coats of arms often feature symbols and emblems associated with Albanian history and culture.

# Ecclesiastical coats of arms

The Albanian Orthodox Church and the Catholic Church in Albania use coats of arms to represent themselves. These coats of arms often feature symbols and emblems associated with the church and its history.

## Coats of arms

Many Albanian clergy and bishops use coats of arms to represent themselves. These coats of arms often feature symbols and emblems associated with the clergy and their office.

## Seals

The Albanian Orthodox Church and the Catholic Church in Albania use seals to authenticate documents and represent themselves. These seals often feature symbols and emblems associated with the church and its history.

# In society

Heraldry plays a significant role in Albanian society, particularly in the context of national identity and cultural heritage. Many Albanians use coats of arms and other symbols to represent themselves and their families, and these symbols are often passed down through generations.

article:
Ole Miss riot of 1962

The Ole Miss riot of 1962 was a violent confrontation between federal authorities and protesters that took place on the campus of the University of Mississippi (also known as Ole Miss) in Oxford, Mississippi, on September 30, 1962. The event was sparked by the attempt of James Meredith, an African American student, to enroll at the university, which had previously been segregated. The riot resulted in two deaths, numerous injuries, and widespread property damage.

# Leadup

The Ole Miss riot of 1962 was the culmination of a long and contentious process to desegregate the University of Mississippi.

## Meredith's attempts to enroll

James Meredith, a 29-year-old African American veteran, had been trying to enroll at the University of Mississippi since January 1961. Meredith had grown up in Mississippi and had served in the United States Air Force. After his military service, he attended Jackson State College, a historically black college in Mississippi. However, Meredith was determined to attend Ole Miss, which he believed would provide him with better educational opportunities.

Meredith's application to Ole Miss was rejected, citing a technicality that his application was incomplete. Undeterred, Meredith reapplied, and his application was again rejected. Meredith then filed a lawsuit against the university, alleging that he was being discriminated against because of his race. The lawsuit was heard in federal court, where Judge Sidney Mize ruled in Meredith's favor, ordering the university to admit him.

## Kennedy dialogue and escalating tensions

As the date of Meredith's enrollment approached, tensions began to escalate. Governor Ross Barnett, a segregationist, vowed to block Meredith's admission, stating that he would "not surrender to the evil and illegal forces of tyranny." President John F. Kennedy, who had been monitoring the situation, attempted to reason with Barnett, urging him to comply with the federal court order.

However, Barnett refused to back down, and the situation continued to deteriorate. On September 25, 1962, a group of protesters gathered outside the university's administration building, chanting slogans and waving Confederate flags. The protesters were met by a force of state troopers, who were deployed to maintain order.

# Events

The events of September 30, 1962, would prove to be a turning point in the history of the University of Mississippi.

## Meredith arrives

On the morning of September 30, 1962, James Meredith arrived on the campus of the University of Mississippi, accompanied by a group of federal marshals. The marshals had been deployed to protect Meredith from any potential harm. As Meredith and the marshals approached the administration building, they were met by a large crowd of protesters.

## Violence on campus

The protesters, many of whom were students, began to chant and throw rocks at the marshals. The situation quickly escalated, with protesters attempting to block the entrance to the building. The marshals, who were armed with tear gas and batons, attempted to disperse the crowd.

However, the protesters refused to back down, and the situation rapidly spiraled out of control. Rocks and bricks were thrown at the marshals, who responded with tear gas. The protesters, many of whom were wearing gas masks, continued to press forward.

## Military response

As the situation continued to deteriorate, President Kennedy deployed a force of federal troops to the campus. The troops, who were armed with rifles and bayonets, were deployed to restore order and protect Meredith.

The troops, who were met with resistance from the protesters, began to move forward, attempting to clear a path for Meredith. The protesters, who were armed with rocks and bottles, continued to resist, but were eventually forced back by the troops.

## Aftermath

The aftermath of the riot was marked by widespread property damage and numerous injuries. Two people, a journalist and a bystander, were killed during the riot. Many others were injured, including several federal marshals and troops.

Meredith, who had been the target of the protesters' anger, was unharmed. He was eventually escorted to his dormitory, where he was placed under the protection of federal marshals.

# Legacy

The Ole Miss riot of 1962 had a profound impact on the history of the University of Mississippi and the state of Mississippi as a whole. The event marked a turning point in the civil rights movement, highlighting the need for federal intervention to protect the rights of African Americans.

The riot also had a profound impact on James Meredith, who went on to graduate from the university in 1963. Meredith's courage and determination in the face of overwhelming opposition helped to pave the way for future generations of African American students.

# Notes and references

The Ole Miss riot of 1962 was a complex and multifaceted event, involving a range of individuals and organizations.

article:
Speak Now (Taylor's Version)

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) is the re-recorded version of American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift's third studio album, Speak Now (2010). It was released on July 7, 2023, through Republic Records. The album marks the third re-recorded album by Swift, following Fearless (Taylor's Version) (2021) and Red (Taylor's Version) (2021).

#Background

In June 2019, it was announced that Swift's master recordings had been sold to Scooter Braun's company, Ithaca Holdings. Swift publicly expressed her disapproval of the deal and announced plans to re-record her back catalog in an effort to regain control over her music. In November 2020, Swift revealed that she had begun re-recording her older albums, with the first re-recorded album being Fearless (Taylor's Version).

In an interview with Rolling Stone, Swift explained that she had decided to re-record Speak Now because it was an album that was "very close to her heart." She also stated that she was excited to "re-imagine" the album with a fresh perspective and new production.

#Music and lyrics

##Composition

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) features re-recorded versions of the original album's 14 tracks, as well as six additional tracks "From the Vault." The album's sound is characterized by its country-pop and pop-rock influences, with Swift's lyrics exploring themes of love, heartbreak, and self-empowerment.

The re-recorded tracks feature new instrumentation and production, with Swift working with producers such as Aaron Dessner and Jack Antonoff. The album's sound is more polished and refined compared to the original, with Swift's vocals showcasing her growth as a singer-songwriter.

##"From the Vault" tracks

The six "From the Vault" tracks were written and recorded during the original Speak Now era but did not make the final cut for the album. These tracks offer a glimpse into Swift's creative process and provide fans with new insights into her songwriting.

The "From the Vault" tracks include "Ours," "Superstar," "Electric Touch," "When Emma Falls in Love," "I Can See You," and "Castles Crumbling." These tracks feature Swift's signature storytelling and poetic lyrics, with themes ranging from love and heartbreak to self-discovery and empowerment.

#Release

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) was released on July 7, 2023, through Republic Records. The album was available in various formats, including digital, CD, and vinyl. The album's release was accompanied by a social media campaign, with Swift sharing behind-the-scenes glimpses into the recording process and interacting with fans.

The album's release was met with widespread excitement and anticipation, with fans eagerly awaiting the opportunity to hear Swift's re-imagined versions of her classic tracks.

#Critical reception

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Critics praised Swift's re-imagined versions of her classic tracks, as well as the new "From the Vault" tracks.

Rolling Stone praised the album, stating that Swift's re-recorded tracks "sound more vibrant and alive than ever before." The New York Times noted that Swift's vocals on the album are "more nuanced and expressive than ever before."

The album also received praise from country music critics, with Country Music Magazine stating that the album is "a testament to Swift's growth as a singer-songwriter."

#Commercial performance

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) was a commercial success, debuting at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart. The album also reached number one on the UK Albums Chart and the Australian Albums Chart.

The album's success was driven by strong streaming numbers, with the album's tracks accumulating millions of streams on platforms such as Spotify and Apple Music.

#Recognition

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) received several award nominations, including Album of the Year at the 2024 Grammy Awards.

The album's success also led to Swift being named one of Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

article:
2022 Missile Explosion in Poland

On November 15, 2022, a missile explosion occurred in Przewodów, a village in eastern Poland, near the border with Ukraine. The incident took place during the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, which had begun in February 2022. The explosion resulted in the deaths of two Polish citizens and raised concerns about the potential escalation of the conflict.

# Background

The Russian invasion of Ukraine had been ongoing for several months prior to the incident, with both sides engaging in intense fighting and exchanging missile strikes. The conflict had also led to a significant increase in military activity in the region, with both Russian and Ukrainian forces deploying troops and equipment along the border.

Poland, a NATO member country, had been providing military aid to Ukraine and had also increased its own military presence along the border. The country had also been hosting thousands of Ukrainian refugees who had fled the conflict.

# Explosion

On the evening of November 15, 2022, a missile exploded in the village of Przewodów, which is located in the Lublin Voivodeship of eastern Poland. The explosion occurred at around 3:40 pm local time and resulted in the deaths of two Polish citizens, who were identified as Bogusław Wos and Bogdan Ciupek. Several others were also injured in the blast.

The missile was reported to have been a Soviet-era S-300 surface-to-air missile, which is used by both Russian and Ukrainian forces. The exact origin of the missile was not immediately clear, and both sides denied responsibility for the incident.

# Investigation

An investigation into the incident was launched by Polish authorities, with assistance from NATO and Ukrainian officials. The investigation focused on determining the origin of the missile and the circumstances surrounding the explosion.

Polish officials reported that the missile had been fired from Ukrainian territory, but it was not clear whether it had been intentionally targeted at Poland or had strayed off course. Ukrainian officials denied that their forces had intentionally fired on Poland, and Russian officials also denied responsibility for the incident.

# Reactions

## Poland

The Polish government condemned the incident and called for an emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council. Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki stated that the incident was a "serious escalation" of the conflict and called for increased military support for Ukraine.

Polish President Andrzej Duda also condemned the incident and stated that Poland would take all necessary measures to protect its citizens. The Polish government also announced that it would increase its military presence along the border with Ukraine.

## International

### Russia

Russian officials denied responsibility for the incident and accused Ukraine of firing the missile. Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova stated that the incident was a "provocation" by Ukraine and called for an investigation into the circumstances surrounding the explosion.

### Ukraine

Ukrainian officials denied that their forces had intentionally fired on Poland and stated that the incident was likely the result of a Russian missile that had strayed off course. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stated that Ukraine would cooperate fully with the investigation and called for increased military support from NATO.

### NATO officials and member countries

NATO officials condemned the incident and expressed support for Poland. NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg stated that the incident was a "serious escalation" of the conflict and called for increased military support for Ukraine.

Several NATO member countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and Germany, expressed support for Poland and called for an investigation into the incident.

### Others

The European Union also condemned the incident and expressed support for Poland. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen stated that the incident was a "serious escalation" of the conflict and called for increased support for Ukraine.

## Related incidents

The 2022 missile explosion in Poland was not the first incident involving stray missiles during the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Several other incidents had occurred in the preceding months, including a missile strike on a Ukrainian shopping mall in June 2022 that resulted in the deaths of several civilians.

## See also

* Russian invasion of Ukraine
* NATO–Russia relations
* Poland–Russia relations
* Poland–Ukraine relations

article:
Kokshetau
================

Kokshetau is a city located in northern Kazakhstan, serving as the administrative center of Akmola Region. With a rich history dating back to the 19th century, the city has evolved into a significant cultural, economic, and educational hub in the region.

Names and Etymology
--------------------

The city's name has undergone changes throughout its history.

### Chronology of Name Changes

* 1824: The settlement was initially named Kokchetav, derived from the Kazakh words "kok" meaning "blue" and "chetav" meaning "hill."
* 1868: The name was changed to Kokchetavsk.
* 1993: After Kazakhstan gained independence, the city's name was changed to its current form, Kokshetau.

Physical Geography and Geology
-----------------------------

### Location

Kokshetau is situated in the northern part of Kazakhstan, approximately 300 kilometers northwest of the country's capital, Astana. The city is nestled in the Kokchetav Upland, a region of hills and mountains.

### Time

Kokshetau is in the UTC+6 time zone.

### Climate

The city experiences a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm summers. The average temperature in January, the coldest month, is around -15°C, while the average temperature in July, the warmest month, is around 20°C.

Legal Status and Administrative-Territorial Division
-------------------------------------------------

### Administrative Districts and Microdistricts

Kokshetau is divided into three administrative districts: Kokchetav, Esil, and Zerenda. The city also comprises several microdistricts, including Shanyrak, Kokzhal, and others.

### Districts

The city's districts are further divided into smaller areas, each with its own unique character and amenities.

Authorities, Local Government, and Politics
------------------------------------------

### Kokshetau Authorities

The city is governed by the Akimat of Kokshetau, which is responsible for implementing regional policies and overseeing local administration.

### Regional Authorities

The Akmola Region Akimat is the regional governing body, responsible for overseeing the region's development and implementing national policies.

* 2006-2012: Zhaksybek Mukhamedzhanov

#### Politics

Kokshetau is a significant political hub in the region, with several political parties and organizations represented in the city.

History
--------

### Early History

The area around Kokshetau has been inhabited since ancient times, with archaeological finds dating back to the Bronze Age.

### Foundation of Kokshetau (1824–1917)

The city was founded in 1824 as a Russian military outpost, and it quickly grew into a significant trade center. During the 19th century, Kokshetau became a major hub for the Russian Empire's expansion into Central Asia.

### Soviet Era (1918–1991)

Following the Russian Revolution, Kokshetau became part of the Soviet Union. During this period, the city underwent significant industrialization and urbanization.

### Fall of the Soviet Union and Modern History (1991–present)

With the dissolution of the Soviet Union, Kokshetau became part of an independent Kazakhstan. Since then, the city has continued to grow and develop, with a focus on education, culture, and economic development.

Demographics

### Population

As of 2020, the population of Kokshetau is approximately 145,000 people.

### Languages

Kazakh and Russian are the most widely spoken languages in the city, with many residents also speaking English and other languages.

### Ethnic and National Composition

The city's population is predominantly Kazakh, with significant Russian and other ethnic minority populations.

#### Russian Orthodox Church

#### Other Religions

Other religions, including Catholicism, Protestantism, and Buddhism, are also represented in Kokshetau.

Kokshetau has several theaters, including the Kokshetau Drama Theater and the Akmola Regional Philharmonic.

### National Events/Festivals

The city hosts several national events and festivals throughout the year, including the Nauryz celebrations and the Akmola Region Day.

### Philharmonic

The Akmola Regional Philharmonic is a popular cultural institution in the city, hosting concerts and performances throughout the year.

### Historical Museums

Kokshetau has several historical museums, including the Akmola Region Museum of History and Local Lore.

### Cinemas

The city has several cinemas, showing a range of Kazakh and international films.

### Libraries

#### Public Libraries

#### University Libraries

The city's universities also have their own libraries, providing access to a wide range of academic resources.

### Kazakhstan Capital of Culture 2021

In 2021, Kokshetau was designated as the Kazakhstan Capital of Culture, recognizing the city's significant cultural contributions to the country.

### Palaces

### Mausoleums

### Cemeteries

Economy and Services
--------------------

### Industry

2022–23 Australian region cyclone season

The 2022–23 Australian region cyclone season is the period of the year when most tropical cyclones form in the southern Indian Ocean and southern Pacific Ocean, within the area bounded by longitudes 90°E and 160°E, and south of the equator. The season officially began on 1 November 2022 and will end on 30 April 2023.

# Season forecasts

The Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) issued their seasonal forecasts for the 2022–23 Australian region cyclone season in October 2022.

The BOM forecast a near-average to above-average number of tropical cyclones for the season, with 11 tropical cyclones predicted to form in the Australian region. NOAA forecast a 60% chance of an above-average number of tropical cyclones for the season.

# Season summary

The 2022–23 Australian region cyclone season was marked by a series of intense and destructive cyclones that affected several countries in the region. The season saw a total of 14 named tropical cyclones, with 5 of them reaching severe tropical cyclone strength.

The season began slowly, with only a few weak tropical lows forming in the first few weeks. However, as the season progressed, the frequency and intensity of the cyclones increased. The most intense cyclone of the season was Severe Tropical Cyclone Freddy, which reached category 5 strength on the Australian cyclone scale and caused widespread destruction in Western Australia.

# Systems

## Tropical Cyclone 01U

Tropical Cyclone 01U was the first tropical cyclone of the season, forming on 1 November 2022 in the southern Indian Ocean. The system moved southwest and intensified into a tropical cyclone, reaching category 2 strength on the Australian cyclone scale. However, it soon weakened and dissipated on 4 November 2022.

## Tropical Low 02U

Tropical Low 02U formed on 10 November 2022 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system moved west and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 13 November 2022.

## Severe Tropical Cyclone Darian

Severe Tropical Cyclone Darian formed on 15 November 2022 in the southern Indian Ocean. Darian caused significant damage and disruption in Western Australia before making landfall on 22 November 2022.

## Tropical Cyclone Ellie

Tropical Cyclone Ellie formed on 25 November 2022 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system intensified into a tropical cyclone and moved west, reaching category 3 strength on the Australian cyclone scale. However, it soon weakened and dissipated on 30 November 2022.

Tropical Low 07U (Hale) formed on 5 December 2022 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system moved west and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 8 December 2022.

## Tropical Low 11U (Dingani)

Severe Tropical Cyclone Freddy formed on 30 December 2022 in the southern Indian Ocean. The system intensified rapidly and reached category 5 strength on the Australian cyclone scale, becoming the most intense cyclone of the season. ## Tropical Low 15U

Tropical Low 15U formed on 15 January 2023 in the southern Indian Ocean. The system moved southwest and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 18 January 2023.

## Tropical Low 17U

## Tropical Low 18U (Kevin)

Tropical Low 18U (Kevin) formed on 30 January 2023 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system moved west and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 2 February 2023.

## Tropical Low 20U

Tropical Low 20U formed on 5 February 2023 in the southern Indian Ocean. The system moved southwest and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 8 February 2023.

## Severe Tropical Cyclone Herman

Severe Tropical Cyclone Herman formed on 10 February 2023 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system intensified rapidly and reached category 4 strength on the Australian cyclone scale. Herman caused significant damage and disruption in New Caledonia before making landfall on 14 February 2023.

## Tropical Low 22U

Tropical Low 22U formed on 15 February 2023 in the southern Indian Ocean. The system moved southwest and intensified into a tropical low, but failed to develop further and dissipated on 18 February 2023.

## Severe Tropical Cyclone Ilsa

Severe Tropical Cyclone Ilsa formed on 20 February 2023 in the southern Pacific Ocean. The system intensified rapidly and reached category 5 strength on the Australian cyclone scale, becoming the second severe tropical cyclone of the season. Ilsa caused widespread destruction and disruption in Western Australia before making landfall on 25 February 2023.

# Storm names

article:
Sacré-Cœur, Paris

The Basilique du Sacré-Cœur, commonly known as Sacré-Cœur, is a Roman Catholic church located in the 18th arrondissement of Paris, France. Perched on a hill in the heart of the city, the church is one of the most iconic landmarks in Paris and a popular tourist destination.

# History

## Proposal

The idea of building a church dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus in Paris dates back to the 19th century. In 1870, during the Franco-Prussian War, a group of French Catholics, led by Father Jean-Baptiste Pétavel, proposed the construction of a church as a symbol of devotion to the Sacred Heart. The proposal was initially met with skepticism, but it gained momentum after the war.

## Site

The site chosen for the church was the hill of Montmartre, a working-class neighborhood in the north of Paris. The hill had a long history of spiritual significance, dating back to the Middle Ages. In the 19th century, it was a popular spot for artists and intellectuals, including Claude Monet and Pierre-Auguste Renoir.

## Construction

The construction of Sacré-Cœur began in 1875 and took nearly 40 years to complete. The architect, Paul Abadie, designed the church in a Byzantine-Romanesque style, inspired by the churches of southern France and Italy. The church was built using white Château-Landon stone, which gives it its distinctive appearance.

## Controversy over the church

The construction of Sacré-Cœur was not without controversy. Many Parisians saw the church as a symbol of the Catholic Church's power and influence, and some opposed its construction on secular grounds. The church was also seen as a provocation to the Republican government, which had recently come to power in France.

# Description

## Exterior

The exterior of Sacré-Cœur is characterized by its white stone façade, which is dominated by a large dome. The church is built on a hill, and the dome rises 83 meters (272 feet) above the city. The façade is decorated with intricate mosaics and sculptures, including a statue of the Virgin Mary.

## Interior

The interior of Sacré-Cœur is equally impressive, with a large nave and a series of chapels dedicated to various saints. The church is decorated with intricate mosaics and stained glass windows, which flood the interior with color and light.

### The Triumph of the Sacred Heart of Jesus mosaic

One of the most striking features of Sacré-Cœur is the mosaic that adorns the apse. The mosaic, titled "The Triumph of the Sacred Heart of Jesus," was designed by Luc-Olivier Merson and covers an area of over 1,000 square meters (10,764 square feet). The mosaic depicts the Sacred Heart of Jesus surrounded by angels and saints.

### Chapels

Sacré-Cœur has a series of chapels dedicated to various saints, including Saint Joan of Arc and Saint Thérèse of Lisieux. The chapels are decorated with intricate mosaics and stained glass windows.

### Crypt

The crypt of Sacré-Cœur is a peaceful oasis in the heart of the city. The crypt is dedicated to the memory of Father Jean-Baptiste Pétavel, who proposed the construction of the church. It contains a number of tombs and memorials, including a statue of the Virgin Mary.

## Art and decoration

Sacré-Cœur is renowned for its stunning art and decoration. The church contains a number of impressive mosaics, including the famous "Triumph of the Sacred Heart of Jesus" mosaic. The church is also decorated with intricate stained glass windows, which flood the interior with color and light.

### Stained glass

The stained glass windows of Sacré-Cœur are some of the most impressive in the world. The windows were designed by a number of famous artists, including Charles Leprince and Henri Ottmann. They depict a range of scenes, including biblical stories and the lives of saints.

### Sculpture

Sacré-Cœur contains a number of impressive sculptures, including a statue of the Virgin Mary and a series of sculptures depicting the Stations of the Cross. The sculptures were designed by a number of famous artists, including Hippolyte Lefèbvre and Jules Coutan.

## Grand organ

Sacré-Cœur has a magnificent grand organ, which was built by the famous organ builder, Aristide Cavaillé-Coll. The organ has over 8,000 pipes and is considered one of the finest in the world.

## Bells

Sacré-Cœur has a number of impressive bells, including a large bell that weighs over 14 tons. The bells were cast by the famous bell foundry, Paccard.

# Role in Catholicism

Sacré-Cœur plays an important role in Catholicism, both in France and around the world. The church is a popular pilgrimage site, attracting millions of visitors each year. The church is also an important center of devotion to the Sacred Heart of Jesus, a popular Catholic devotion.

# Access

Sacré-Cœur is located in the 18th arrondissement of Paris, near the top of the hill of Montmartre. The church is accessible by metro (line 4, station Barbès-Rochechouart) or by bus (lines 30, 31, and 54).

# Copy in Martinique

A copy of Sacré-Cœur was built in the French Caribbean island of Martinique. The church, which is also dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus, was built in the early 20th century and is a popular tourist destination.

article:
Don't Worry Darling
================

Don't Worry Darling is a 2022 American psychological thriller film directed by Olivia Wilde from a screenplay by Katie Silberman. The film stars Florence Pugh, Harry Styles, Chris Pine, Gemma Chan, Nick Kroll, and KiKi Layne. It follows a young housewife who begins to suspect that her seemingly perfect life in a utopian community is not what it appears to be.

Plot
-----

The film is set in the 1950s in the idyllic town of Victory, California, a utopian community created by a mysterious and charismatic leader, Frank (Chris Pine). The town is inhabited by successful men and their subservient wives, who are expected to be perfect homemakers and mothers. The story centers around Alice (Florence Pugh), a young and beautiful housewife who is married to Jack (Harry Styles), a talented engineer who works for Frank.

Alice's life appears perfect, with a loving husband, a beautiful home, and a tight-knit community of friends. However, as the story progresses, Alice begins to experience strange and unsettling events that make her question her reality. She starts to notice that the women in the community are being controlled and manipulated by their husbands and the community's leader, Frank.

As Alice's suspicions grow, she becomes increasingly paranoid and isolated, causing tension in her marriage and her relationships with her friends. She starts to investigate the truth about Victory and Frank's intentions, which puts her in grave danger. The film's climax reveals the dark secrets behind Frank's utopian community, and Alice must make a choice between conforming to the community's expectations or fighting for her freedom.

Cast
-----

* Florence Pugh as Alice Chambers
* Harry Styles as Jack Chambers
* Chris Pine as Frank
* Gemma Chan as Shelley
* Nick Kroll as Bill
* KiKi Layne as Margaret
* Sydney Chandler as Bunny
* Kate Berlant as Peg
* Asif Ali as Peter
* Douglas Smith as Jeff
* Timothy Simons as Dean
* Ari'el Stachel as Ted

Production
------------

### Development and writing

Don't Worry Darling was first announced in August 2019, with Olivia Wilde set to direct and Katie Silberman writing the screenplay. The film is produced by Wilde, Silberman, Miri Yoon, and Roy Lee. The story is loosely based on the 1975 film "The Stepford Wives," but Silberman has stated that she drew inspiration from various sources, including the works of Jordan Peele and the TV series "The Twilight Zone."

### Casting

Florence Pugh was the first actress to be cast in the film, with Harry Styles joining the cast in September 2020. Chris Pine was cast as the film's villain, Frank, in October 2020. The rest of the cast, including Gemma Chan, Nick Kroll, and KiKi Layne, were announced in January 2021.

### Filming

Principal photography began on October 20, 2020, in Palm Springs, California. The film was shot on location in Palm Springs and surrounding areas, with some scenes filmed in Los Angeles. Filming wrapped on February 13, 2021.

### Alleged conflicts on set

There were reports of tension and conflict on set during filming, particularly between Wilde and the film's cast members.

#### Wilde and LaBeouf

Shia LaBeouf was originally cast in the film but dropped out due to scheduling conflicts. However, there were reports that LaBeouf had clashed with Wilde over the film's script and direction. LaBeouf denied these reports, stating that he had simply decided to focus on other projects.

#### Wilde and Pugh

There were also reports of tension between Wilde and Florence Pugh, with some sources suggesting that the two had clashed over the film's direction and Pugh's character. However, both Wilde and Pugh have denied these reports, stating that they had a positive working relationship.

Marketing
---------

The film's first trailer was released on May 2, 2022, and received widespread attention on social media. The trailer featured footage of Pugh's character, Alice, as well as glimpses of the film's utopian community and its sinister underbelly.

Release
-------

April 1904 was the fourth month of the year 1904, which was a leap year. It began on a Friday and ended on a Saturday after 30 days.

# April 1, 1904 (Friday)

April 1, 1904, was the 92nd day of the year. It was also April Fool's Day, a traditional day for playing pranks and jokes on others.

## Events

* The 1904 World's Fair, also known as the Louisiana Purchase Exposition, was scheduled to open in St. Louis, Missouri, on this day. However, due to construction delays, the opening was postponed until April 30.
* The United States Senate passed a resolution authorizing the construction of a canal across the Isthmus of Panama.

Kumar Sanu Discography and Filmography

Kumar Sanu is a renowned Indian playback singer, primarily singing in Hindi, Bengali, and other languages. With a career spanning over four decades, he has recorded over 20,000 songs and has won numerous awards, including the prestigious Padma Shri. Sanu's discography and filmography are a testament to his versatility and talent, with a wide range of songs in various languages and genres.

#Hindi films songs

Kumar Sanu has sung in numerous Hindi films, with some of his most notable works including:

* Aashiqui (1990) - Sanu's breakthrough film, which earned him the Filmfare Award for Best Male Playback Singer
* Dil (1990) - Sanu sang several hit songs for this film, including "Mujhe Neend Na Aaye"
* Baaghi (1990) - Sanu's duets with Alka Yagnik, such as "Kaisa Lagta Hai", were major hits
* Deewana (1992) - Sanu's songs, including "Sochenge Tumhe Pyaar", were chart-toppers
* Hum Aapke Hain Koun..! (1994) - Sanu sang several songs for this blockbuster film, including "Maye Ni Maye"
* Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge (1995) - Sanu's duets with Lata Mangeshkar, such as "Tujhe Dekha To", are iconic
* Kuch Kuch Hota Hai (1998) - Sanu sang several hit songs for this film, including "Koi Mil Gaya"

#Hindi Albums songs

Kumar Sanu has released several successful Hindi albums, including:

* Kalyanji-Anandji's "Kumar Sanu - Kalyanji-Anandji" (1993) - a collection of duets with Alka Yagnik
* "Hum Tum" (1995) - a duet album with Alka Yagnik
* "Kumar Sanu - Aap Ki Yaad" (1996) - a solo album featuring hit songs like "Aap Ki Yaad"
* "Kumar Sanu - Pyaar Ka Jalwa" (1999) - a duet album with Alka Yagnik

article:
2023 XFL Season

The 2023 XFL season is the third season of the revived XFL, a professional American football league owned by Dany Garcia, Dwayne Johnson, and Gerry Cardinale. The season began on February 18, 2023, and will conclude with the championship game on May 13, 2023.

#Background

The XFL was re-established in 2018 by Vince McMahon, but the league suspended operations in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. In 2021, the league was sold to Garcia, Johnson, and Cardinale, who rebranded the league and announced plans to relaunch in 2023.

#Teams

The 2023 XFL season features eight teams, divided into two divisions:

* North Division:
	+ DC Defenders
	+ Seattle Sea Dragons
	+ St. Louis Battlehawks
	+ Vegas Vipers
* South Division:
	+ Arlington Renegades
	+ Houston Roughnecks
	+ Orlando Guardians
	+ San Antonio Brahmas

#Players

##Draft

The 2023 XFL Draft took place on November 15, 2022. Each team selected 42 players, with the DC Defenders having the first overall pick.

##Compensation

XFL players are paid a weekly salary, with the amount increasing based on performance and experience. The league also offers a signing bonus to players who are selected in the draft or signed as free agents.

##Player movement

Players can be released or traded by their teams at any time during the season. The XFL also has a waiver system, which allows teams to claim players who have been released by other teams.

##Partnerships

###Indoor Football League

The XFL has a partnership with the Indoor Football League (IFL), which allows players to be assigned to IFL teams during the XFL offseason.

###NFL Alumni Academy

The XFL also has a partnership with the NFL Alumni Academy, which provides players with training and development opportunities.

#Coaches

#Rule changes

The XFL has several rule changes compared to the NFL, including:

* A 25-second play clock, compared to 40 seconds in the NFL
* A shorter overtime period, with a maximum of three possessions per team
* A "comeback period" in the fourth quarter, which allows teams to regain possession of the ball after a score

The 2023 XFL preseason consists of two weeks of training camp and a single preseason game per team.

##Regular season

The regular season consists of 10 weeks, with each team playing five home games and five away games.

##Postseason

The postseason consists of a single-elimination tournament, with the top two teams from each division qualifying for the playoffs.

Philippines at the 2021 SEA Games

The Philippines participated at the 2021 Southeast Asian Games in Hanoi, Vietnam from May 12 to 23, 2022. The country's participation marked its 19th appearance at the biennial multi-sport event. The Philippines sent a total of 656 athletes, 285 officials, and 36 volunteers to the Games.

# Preparations

The Philippine Sports Commission (PSC) and the Philippine Olympic Committee (POC) were responsible for the country's preparation for the 2021 SEA Games. The PSC allocated a budget of PHP 600 million for the training and preparation of Filipino athletes, while the POC coordinated with the national sports associations (NSAs) to select the athletes who would represent the country.

The Philippine team underwent training and preparation in various locations in the country, including the PhilSports Complex in Pasig, the Rizal Memorial Sports Complex in Manila, and the New Clark City Sports Complex in Capas, Tarlac. The team also held training camps in foreign countries, such as Japan, South Korea, and the United States, to gain more experience and compete against top-level athletes.

# Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the Philippines' preparation for the 2021 SEA Games. The pandemic led to the cancellation of several international competitions and training camps, which affected the team's preparation and training. The PSC and the POC had to adjust the team's training program to ensure the safety and well-being of the athletes.

Fast X
================

Fast X is a 2023 American action thriller film directed by Louis Leterrier and written by Justin Lin and Dan Mazeau. It is the tenth main installment in the Fast and Furious franchise and the sequel to F9 (2021). The film stars Vin Diesel, Michelle Rodriguez, Tyrese Gibson, Chris "Ludacris" Bridges, Jordana Brewster, and Sung Kang, reprising their roles from previous films, alongside new cast members Jason Momoa, Daniela Melchior, and Brie Larson.

Plot
=====

The film takes place after the events of F9, with Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) and his family facing a new threat in the form of Dante Reyes (Jason Momoa), the son of a wealthy and powerful Brazilian businessman who seeks revenge against Dom and his team for foiling his father's plans. As Dom and his team try to take down Dante, they are forced to confront their own past and the consequences of their actions.

Cast
=====

* Vin Diesel as Dominic Toretto
* Michelle Rodriguez as Letty Ortiz
* Tyrese Gibson as Roman Pearce
* Chris "Ludacris" Bridges as Tej Parker
* Jordana Brewster as Mia Toretto
* Sung Kang as Han Lue
* Jason Momoa as Dante Reyes
* Daniela Melchior as Isabel Neves
* Brie Larson as Tess Parker

Production
==========

### Development

In April 2020, it was announced that Justin Lin would return to direct the next two films in the Fast and Furious franchise, with Vin Diesel set to reprise his role as Dominic Toretto. However, in November 2021, Lin stepped down as director and writer, citing creative differences with the studio. Louis Leterrier was subsequently hired to replace Lin as director.

### Writing

Dan Mazeau took over as writer, working from a story by Mazeau and Lin. The script was rewritten several times, with input from the cast and other writers. The film's story was influenced by the COVID-19 pandemic, which affected the production schedule and forced the writers to make changes to the script.

### Casting

Jason Momoa was cast as the main villain, Dante Reyes, in January 2022. Daniela Melchior and Brie Larson joined the cast in February 2022, playing the roles of Isabel Neves and Tess Parker, respectively.

### Filming

Principal photography began on April 18, 2022, in Italy, with filming also taking place in Portugal, Brazil, and the United States. The film's stunts were performed by a combination of professional drivers and stuntmen, with the cast also performing some of their own stunts.

#### Vehicles

The film features a range of high-performance vehicles, including the Dodge Charger, the Plymouth Road Runner, and the Ferrari 488 GTB. The film's stunts were designed to showcase the cars' capabilities, with the stunt team using a combination of practical effects and CGI to create the film's action sequences.

### Post-production

Post-production on the film began in June 2022, with editing and visual effects work taking place over the next several months. The film's score was composed by Brian Tyler, who has worked on several previous films in the Fast and Furious franchise.

### Music

The film's soundtrack features a mix of hip-hop and rock music, with contributions from artists such as Cardi B, Nicki Minaj, and Post Malone. The soundtrack was released on April 28, 2023, to coincide with the film's release.

Marketing
=========

The film's marketing campaign began in November 2022, with the release of the first trailer. The trailer was viewed over 10 million times on YouTube in its first 24 hours, making it one of the most-watched trailers of the year.

Release
=======

### Theatrical

Fast X was released in theaters on April 28, 2023, in the United States and other countries. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, with some theaters also offering Dolby Cinema and D-Box screenings.

### Home media

The film will be released on home media on August 22, 2023, with Blu-ray, DVD, and digital download options available.

Reception
==========

### Box office

Fast X opened at number one at the box office in the United States, grossing $71.5 million in its opening weekend. The film has grossed over $500 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2023.

### Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the film's action sequences and performances, while others criticized the film's plot and characters. The film holds a 52% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 222 reviews.

### Accolades

The film was nominated for several awards, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Action Movie.

Sequel
======

A sequel to Fast X is in development, with Vin Diesel set to reprise his role as Dominic Toretto. The film is expected to be released in 2025.

article:
Typhoon Mawar

Typhoon Mawar was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected the Mariana Islands and other parts of the western Pacific Ocean in May 2024. The storm brought strong winds, heavy rainfall, and significant damage to the region, particularly in Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands.

# Meteorological history

Mawar formed as a tropical depression on May 12, 2024, to the southeast of the Mariana Islands. The system initially moved northwestward, gradually intensifying into a tropical storm by May 14. Over the next few days, Mawar continued to strengthen, fueled by warm ocean waters and low wind shear. By May 16, the storm had become a typhoon, with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/h (75 mph). Mawar's intensification trend continued, and by May 18, the storm had reached its peak intensity as a Category 4-equivalent typhoon, with winds of 240 km/h (150 mph) and a central pressure of 935 hPa (27.61 inHg).

# Preparations

As Mawar approached the Mariana Islands, authorities took measures to prepare for the storm's impact.

## Mariana Islands

On May 15, the National Weather Service (NWS) issued a Typhoon Watch for Guam and the Northern Mariana Islands. The watch was upgraded to a Typhoon Warning on May 16, as Mawar's forecast track indicated a direct hit on the islands. The Government of Guam activated its Emergency Operations Center, and the Governor declared a state of emergency. Residents were advised to stock up on food, water, and other essential supplies, and to seek shelter in designated safe zones.

## Elsewhere

Other countries in the region also took precautions in anticipation of Mawar's impact. In Japan, the Japan Meteorological Agency issued a High Wave Warning for the southern islands of Okinawa, while in the Philippines, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) issued a Tropical Cyclone Warning Signal for several provinces in the eastern part of the country.

# Impact and aftermath

Mawar brought significant damage and disruption to the Mariana Islands and other parts of the region.

## Guam

Mawar made landfall on Guam on May 18, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall. The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 90% of the island's households losing electricity. Several buildings were damaged or destroyed, including homes, businesses, and government facilities. The island's airport and seaport were also closed due to the storm. According to reports, at least 10 people were injured, and one person was killed.

## Northern Mariana Islands

The Northern Mariana Islands were also severely affected by Mawar. The storm caused significant damage to homes, infrastructure, and crops, particularly on the islands of Saipan and Tinian. Several villages were flooded, and many residents were forced to evacuate their homes. The Commonwealth Healthcare Corporation reported several injuries, but no fatalities.

## Elsewhere

In Japan, Mawar brought high waves and strong winds to the southern islands of Okinawa, causing some damage to buildings and infrastructure. In the Philippines, the storm caused flooding and landslides in several provinces, resulting in at least 20 deaths and several injuries.

article:
2022 Indian Presidential Election

The 2022 Indian presidential election is scheduled to be held on 21 July 2022 to elect the 15th President of India. The election will be the 16th presidential election in the country and will take place to elect a successor to incumbent President Ram Nath Kovind, whose term is set to end on 24 July 2022.

# Electoral System

The President of India is indirectly elected through an electoral college consisting of the elected members of both houses of parliament, the elected members of the legislative assemblies of the 28 states and the elected members of the legislative assemblies of the two union territories with legislatures. The election is held by a secret ballot, with each elector casting a single vote.

The President is elected by the system of proportional representation by means of the single transferable vote method. The voting is done in accordance with the system of proportional representation by means of the single transferable vote method. The electors are required to indicate their first preference by marking '1' against the name of the candidate of their choice. They can also indicate their subsequent preferences by marking '2', '3', etc. against the names of other candidates.

# Election Schedule

The election schedule for the 2022 Indian presidential election was announced by the Election Commission of India on 29 June 2022. The notification for the election was issued on 29 June 2022, and the last date for filing nominations was 7 July 2022. The scrutiny of nominations took place on 8 July 2022, and the last date for withdrawal of candidatures was 11 July 2022. The election will be held on 21 July 2022, and the counting of votes will take place on 24 July 2022.

# Electoral College

The electoral college for the 2022 Indian presidential election consists of 4,896 members, including 776 elected members of parliament and 4,120 elected members of the legislative assemblies of the 28 states and the two union territories with legislatures.

## Electoral College Member Strength

The strength of the electoral college is as follows:

* Elected members of parliament: 776
* Elected members of the legislative assemblies of the 28 states: 4,066
* Elected members of the legislative assemblies of the two union territories with legislatures: 54

## Electoral College Vote Value Composition

The value of the vote of each elector is determined by the population of the state or union territory they represent. The value of the vote of each elector is as follows:

* Members of parliament: 708 votes each
* Members of the legislative assemblies of the states: 175 votes each (average)
* Members of the legislative assemblies of the union territories with legislatures: 58 votes each (average)

# Party-wise Vote (Projection)

The projected party-wise vote share in the 2022 Indian presidential election is as follows:

* National Democratic Alliance: 48.7%
* United Opposition: 43.4%
* Others: 7.9%

# Candidates

## National Democratic Alliance

The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) has nominated Droupadi Murmu as its candidate for the 2022 Indian presidential election. Murmu is a former Governor of Jharkhand and a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

## United Opposition (India)

The United Opposition has nominated Yashwant Sinha as its candidate for the 2022 Indian presidential election. Sinha is a former Minister of Finance and External Affairs and a member of the Trinamool Congress.

# Potential Candidates

Several other potential candidates were rumored to be in the fray for the 2022 Indian presidential election, including:

* Gopalkrishna Gandhi: A former Governor of West Bengal and a grandson of Mahatma Gandhi.
* Meira Kumar: A former Speaker of the Lok Sabha and a member of the Indian National Congress.
* Sharad Pawar: A former Minister of Agriculture and a leader of the Nationalist Congress Party.

# Campaign

The campaign for the 2022 Indian presidential election began in earnest in June 2022, with both candidates crisscrossing the country to seek the support of electors. The campaign has been marked by a bitter war of words between the two sides, with the NDA accusing the United Opposition of trying to divide the country and the United Opposition accusing the NDA of trying to impose its ideology on the country.

# Controversy

The 2022 Indian presidential election has been marked by several controversies, including allegations of horse trading and attempts to influence the electors. The Election Commission of India has issued several notices to the candidates and the parties involved, warning them against violating the model code of conduct.

# Results

The results of the 2022 Indian presidential election will be declared on 24 July 2022. The counting of votes will take place in the morning, and the results are expected to be declared by the evening.

## Breakdown

The breakdown of the results will be as follows:

* State-wise results: The results will be declared state-wise, with the number of votes polled by each candidate in each state.
* Party-wise results: The results will be declared party-wise, with the number of votes polled by each party in each state.
* Overall results: The overall results will be declared, with the number of votes polled by each candidate across the country.

# Reactions

article:
Slavery in Ancient Rome

Slavery was a widespread institution in ancient Rome, playing a vital role in the economy, society, and culture of the Roman Republic and Roman Empire. The practice of slavery in Rome dates back to the city's foundation, with the first recorded mention of slaves in Roman law dating to the 5th century BC. Over time, the institution of slavery evolved, with various laws, social norms, and cultural practices shaping the lives of slaves and their relationships with their owners.

# Origins

The origins of slavery in ancient Rome are complex and multifaceted. While the exact date of the first enslavement of Roman citizens is unknown, it is believed that the practice of slavery began during the Roman Kingdom period (753-509 BC). During this time, prisoners of war and debtors were likely the primary sources of slaves.

## Enslavement of Roman citizens

The enslavement of Roman citizens was a rare occurrence, but it did happen. Roman citizens who were convicted of certain crimes, such as treason or murder, could be sentenced to slavery. Additionally, Roman citizens who were unable to pay their debts could be sold into slavery by their creditors.

# The slave in Roman law and society

Roman law and society recognized slaves as property, with owners having complete control over their lives. However, slaves were also considered persons, with certain rights and protections.

## Marriage and family

Slaves were not allowed to marry, but they could form long-term relationships and have children. However, the children of slaves were also considered slaves, and their owners had the right to sell them or give them away.

## Peculium

Slaves were allowed to accumulate a small amount of money, known as peculium, which they could use to purchase their freedom or improve their living conditions.

## Manumission

Slaves could be freed by their owners through a process known as manumission. This could be done through a formal declaration, a will, or a public ceremony.

## Freedmen

Freedmen, or former slaves, were considered citizens, but they were not equal to freeborn citizens. They were required to show deference to their former owners and were often restricted from holding public office.

## Dediticii

Dediticii were slaves who were considered to be of the lowest status. They were often prisoners of war or slaves who had been convicted of crimes.

# Causes of enslavement

There were several ways in which people became slaves in ancient Rome.

## War captives

War captives were a major source of slaves in ancient Rome. Prisoners of war were often sold into slavery, with the Roman state receiving a portion of the profits.

### Captivi in Roman culture

Captives were often displayed as trophies in Roman triumphs, and their enslavement was seen as a symbol of Roman power and dominance.

2022 Tamil Nadu Premier League
==============================

The 2022 Tamil Nadu Premier League was the sixth edition of the Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL), a professional Twenty20 cricket league established by the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association (TNCA) in India. The tournament featured eight teams, with the league stage taking place from June 23 to July 10, 2022, followed by the playoffs from July 12 to July 15, 2022.

Teams
-----

Eight teams participated in the 2022 Tamil Nadu Premier League:

1.  Chepauk Super Gillies
2.  Dindigul Dragons

article:
Taylor Hawkins

Taylor Hawkins (1972-2022) was an American musician, best known as the drummer for the rock band Foo Fighters. With a career spanning over two decades, Hawkins was widely regarded as one of the most talented and charismatic drummers in the music industry.

#Early life

Oliver Taylor Hawkins was born on February 17, 1972, in Fort Worth, Texas. He grew up in a musical family and was exposed to a wide range of genres from an early age. Hawkins' parents, Elizabeth Ann and Roger Allen Hawkins, encouraged his interest in music, and he began taking piano lessons at the age of six. He later switched to drums, citing the influence of classic rock bands such as The Beatles and Led Zeppelin.

Hawkins attended Thurston Junior High School in Fairfax, Virginia, where he met his future bandmate, Nate Mendel. The two musicians began playing music together, with Hawkins on drums and Mendel on bass. After high school, Hawkins attended Cal State Fullerton, but he dropped out to pursue a career in music.

#Career

##Early career

Before joining Foo Fighters, Hawkins played drums for several bands, including Sylvia and Sass Jordan. In 1995, he joined Alanis Morissette's band, touring extensively and recording with the Canadian singer-songwriter.

##Foo Fighters

In 1997, Hawkins joined Foo Fighters, replacing original drummer William Goldsmith. He made his debut with the band on the album "The Colour and the Shape," which was released in May 1997. With Foo Fighters, Hawkins gained international recognition and critical acclaim, touring extensively and recording several successful albums.

Hawkins' versatility and creative input made him an integral part of Foo Fighters' sound. He sang lead vocals on several tracks, including "Cold Day in the Sun" and "Sunday Rain." His powerful drumming and charismatic stage presence earned him a reputation as one of the most exciting live performers in rock music.

##Other projects

In addition to his work with Foo Fighters, Hawkins pursued various side projects. He formed the band Taylor Hawkins and the Coattail Riders, releasing two albums, "Taylor Hawkins and the Coattail Riders" (2006) and "Red Light Fever" (2010). The band's music was a departure from Foo Fighters' sound, featuring a more experimental and psychedelic style.

Hawkins also collaborated with other artists, including Queen, Brian May, and Slash. He appeared as a guest musician on several albums, including Coheed and Cambria's "Good Apollo, I'm Burning Star IV, Volume One: From Fear Through the Eyes of Madness" (2005).

#Influences

Hawkins cited a wide range of influences, from classic rock bands like Led Zeppelin and The Who to punk rock and new wave acts like The Clash and Blondie. He was also influenced by jazz and fusion music, citing drummers like John Bonham and Neil Peart as major inspirations.

#Equipment

Hawkins was known for his distinctive drumming style, which was characterized by his powerful, energetic playing and his use of a wide range of techniques. He played a variety of drum kits, including Gretsch and DW drums, and was known for his extensive collection of vintage drum equipment.

#Personal life

Hawkins was married to Alison Hawkins, and the couple had three children together. He was known for his charismatic personality and his sense of humor, and he was widely respected by his peers in the music industry.

#Death

Taylor Hawkins passed away on March 25, 2022, at the age of 50. The cause of death was not immediately disclosed, but it was later reported that he had died from a heart condition.

##Tribute concerts

In the wake of Hawkins' death, Foo Fighters announced a series of tribute concerts, featuring a range of guest musicians and drummers. The concerts, which took place in London and Los Angeles, were a celebration of Hawkins' life and music, and they featured performances by artists such as Alanis Morissette, Queen, and Liam Gallagher.

#Discography

* Jagged Little Pill (1995)
* Supposed Former Infatuation Junkie (1998)

##Foo Fighters

* The Colour and the Shape (1997)
* There Is Nothing Left to Lose (1999)
* One by One (2002)
* In Your Honor (2005)
* Echoes, Silence, Patience & Grace (2007)
* Wasting Light (2011)
* Sonic Highways (2014)

* Medicine at Midnight (2021)

##Taylor Hawkins and the Coattail Riders

* Taylor Hawkins and the Coattail Riders (2006)
* Red Light Fever (2010)
* Get the Money (2019)

##Nighttime Boogie Association

* Nighttime Boogie Association (2020)

##NHC

* Intakes & Outtakes (2021)

##The Birds of Satan

* The Birds of Satan (2014)

##Coheed and Cambria

* Good Apollo, I'm Burning Star IV, Volume One: From Fear Through the Eyes of Madness (2005)

##Solo

##Session appearances

* Slash: Slash (2010)
* Brian May: The Candlelight Concerts (2010)

article:
Reindeer
================

Reindeer, also known as caribou in North America, are a species of deer that are well adapted to the harsh, cold climates of the Arctic and subarctic regions. They are an important part of the ecosystem in these regions, playing a key role in shaping the landscape and providing a source of food and clothing for many indigenous communities.

Description
------------

Reindeer are medium-sized deer with a distinctive set of physical characteristics that allow them to thrive in cold, snowy environments. They have a thick coat of fur, a layer of fat, and a circulatory system that is adapted to conserve heat. They also have a unique set of antlers that are grown by both males and females, which are shed and regrown every year.

Status
-------

Reindeer are listed as "vulnerable" on the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List, with many subspecies facing threats such as habitat loss, climate change, and hunting. Conservation efforts are underway to protect reindeer habitats and reduce the impact of human activities on reindeer populations.

Naming
-------

The term "reindeer" is commonly used in Eurasia, while "caribou" is used in North America. The term "reindeer" is derived from the Old Norse word "hreinn," which means "deer." The term "caribou" comes from the French-Canadian word "caribou," which is derived from the Mi'kmaq word "kalibu," meaning "shoveler" or "scraper."

Evolution
----------

Reindeer are believed to have evolved from a common ancestor with other deer species during the Pleistocene era. They are thought to have originated in Asia and migrated to North America across the Bering Land Bridge. Over time, they adapted to the harsh, cold climates of the Arctic and subarctic regions, developing unique physical and behavioral characteristics that allowed them to thrive in these environments.

Taxonomy
----------

### Naming and research on museum collections

Reindeer taxonomy has been the subject of much debate and research over the years. Early studies relied on morphological characteristics, such as antler shape and size, to distinguish between different species and subspecies. However, these characteristics can be variable and do not always provide a clear indication of a reindeer's taxonomic status.

Biological exploration expeditions have played an important role in the discovery and description of new reindeer species and subspecies. These expeditions have allowed scientists to collect and study specimens from remote and inaccessible regions, providing valuable insights into the diversity and distribution of reindeer populations.

Recent studies have led to the reclassification of several reindeer species and subspecies. For example, the woodland caribou was previously considered to be a subspecies of the reindeer, but is now recognized as a distinct species. Reindeer can be divided into several ecotypes, each of which is adapted to a specific set of environmental conditions. For example, the tundra reindeer is adapted to the harsh, treeless conditions of the Arctic tundra, while the forest reindeer is adapted to the more temperate conditions of the boreal forest.

article:
Meteorological History of Cyclone Freddy

Cyclone Freddy was a long-lived and intense tropical cyclone that affected several countries in the South-West Indian Ocean in February and March 2023. The cyclone's meteorological history is a complex and fascinating story of formation, intensification, redevelopment, and dissipation. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the cyclone's life cycle, including its impact on the Mascarene Islands, Madagascar, and Mozambique.

# Formation and Intensification

Cyclone Freddy formed on February 5, 2023, as a tropical disturbance in the South-West Indian Ocean, approximately 700 km (435 miles) north-east of Rodrigues Island, Mauritius. The disturbance was characterized by a low-pressure system, with sustained winds of 30 km/h (18 mph) and a central pressure of 1006 hPa (29.71 inHg).

## Environmental Conditions

The environmental conditions in the South-West Indian Ocean were favorable for the formation and intensification of the cyclone. The sea surface temperature (SST) was warm, ranging from 28°C (82°F) to 30°C (86°F), which provided the necessary heat energy for the cyclone to develop. The atmospheric conditions were also conducive, with low vertical wind shear and high moisture content.

## Rapid Intensification

The cyclone rapidly intensified on February 6 and 7, with sustained winds increasing from 30 km/h (18 mph) to 120 km/h (75 mph) in just 24 hours. This rapid intensification was due to the cyclone's movement over warm waters and its ability to tap into the moisture-rich atmosphere. The cyclone's central pressure decreased to 970 hPa (28.64 inHg) during this period.

# The Mascarene Islands, Madagascar, and Mozambique

Cyclone Freddy brought significant impacts to the Mascarene Islands, Madagascar, and Mozambique. The cyclone passed close to the Mascarene Islands on February 8, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall.

## Mascarene Islands

The cyclone's outer rain bands affected the Mascarene Islands, with sustained winds of 50-60 km/h (31-37 mph) and heavy rainfall. The island of Rodrigues was the most affected, with reports of power outages and damage to homes.

## Madagascar

The cyclone made landfall in Madagascar on February 10, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall. The cyclone's eye passed close to the city of Toamasina, with sustained winds of 120 km/h (75 mph). The cyclone caused significant damage to homes and infrastructure, with reports of power outages and communication disruptions.

## Mozambique

The cyclone made landfall in Mozambique on February 11, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall. The cyclone's eye passed close to the city of Quelimane, with sustained winds of 100 km/h (62 mph). The cyclone caused significant damage to homes and infrastructure, with reports of power outages and communication disruptions.

# Redevelopment and Dissipation

After making landfall in Mozambique, the cyclone began to weaken due to the interaction with the land surface and the dry air from the African continent. However, the cyclone redeveloped over the Mozambique Channel on February 14, with sustained winds increasing to 80 km/h (50 mph).

## Final Dissipation

The cyclone made landfall in Mozambique for the second time on February 16, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall. The cyclone finally dissipated on February 17, with sustained winds decreasing to 30 km/h (18 mph).

# Records

Cyclone Freddy set several records during its lifetime. The cyclone was the longest-lived tropical cyclone in the South-West Indian Ocean, with a duration of 12 days. The cyclone was also the strongest tropical cyclone to affect the Mascarene Islands, with sustained winds of 120 km/h (75 mph).
